instruction: Write an essay about the pros and cons of eating junk food.
output:
Junk food is a pejorative term for food containing high levels of calories from sugar or fat with little fibre, protein, vitamins or minerals. The term can also refer to high protein food like meat prepared with saturated fat such as bacon, or it can refer to food that has been modified to make it extremely appealing and addictive, like certain brands of chocolate. Junk food can be eaten when hungry or as a snack between meals. It is often high in calories relative to the amount of micronutrients.

The term "junk food" dates back at least to the early 1950s. In the book "Junk Food and Fast Food: An Encyclopedia of What We Love to Eat", author Eric Schlosser traces the history of fast food and junk food, beginning in the 1920s. He discusses various aspects of their appeal, including convenience, price, familiarity and marketing.

Fast food restaurants are known for being open late at night, which makes them convenient when other restaurants are closed. They are also known for having large portions, which makes them attractive for customers who want to save money by getting more food for less money.

Fast food is also familiar to many people because they have grown up eating it. This makes it easy for people to eat fast food even when they are not hungry.

Marketing plays an important role in making fast food seem appealing. Advertisements for fast food companies often use celebrities to promote their products. For example, McDonald's uses celebrities in its advertisements to make its food seem appealing.

instruction: Write a paragraph about the worst thing that happened to you in your life.
output: I was born in a small town in the middle of nowhere. I had a happy childhood, but my parents divorced when I was 10 years old. My father moved to another city and I rarely saw him after that. My mother worked hard to support me and my sister, but she died from cancer when I was 15. After her death, I lived with my aunt for a while, but then I decided to move out and live on my own. I got a job at a local grocery store and started saving money. When I turned 18, I bought a car and drove to the city where my father lived. I found his address and knocked on his door. He opened it and looked surprised to see me. We talked for a few minutes, but he didn’t invite me in. He said he was busy and asked me to come back later. I went home feeling sad and disappointed. A few days later, I received a letter from my father. It said that he was sorry, but he couldn’t take care of me anymore. He told me to leave and never come back. I was shocked and angry. I wrote him a letter saying that I would never forgive him for what he did. I packed my bags and left. I haven’t seen or heard from him since.

instruction: Write an essay about your favorite book, what it's about, why you like it so much.
input:
Book: The Great Gatsby by F. Scott Fitzgerald
About the book: The Great Gatsby is a 1925 novel written by American author F. Scott Fitzgerald that follows a cast of characters living in the fictional town of West Egg on prosperous Long Island in the summer of 1922. The story primarily concerns the young and mysterious millionaire Jay Gatsby and his quixotic passion and obsession for the beautiful former debutante Daisy Buchanan.
output:
The Great Gatsby is a classic American novel, which was published in 1925. It is set in New York City and Long Island during the 1920s. The main character, Jay Gatsby, is a wealthy man who has been trying to win back his lost love, Daisy Buchanan. He throws extravagant parties at his mansion every weekend, where all the rich people come to mingle with each other. Nick Carraway, the narrator, is a Yale graduate who rents a house next door to Gatsby's mansion. He becomes friends with Gatsby and tells us about Gatsby's past.
The Great Gatsby is a great book because it shows how materialism can ruin relationships. It also shows how money can't buy happiness.

instruction: Write an essay about how online dating is ruining society.
output:
Online dating is ruining society. It has become a common practice for people to find their significant other online. This is not only affecting the way we date, but also how we view relationships in general. People are no longer looking for someone who they can connect with on an emotional level, but rather someone who looks good on paper. They are more concerned about what the person does for a living and how much money they make than whether or not they have similar interests. The rise of online dating has led to a decline in marriages. In fact, the divorce rate in the United States has increased by 50% since 1960. Online dating is also causing us to lose our ability to communicate effectively. We are losing the art of conversation because we are so used to communicating through text messages and social media. We are becoming less empathetic as well. When you meet someone in person, you can tell if they are being genuine or not. However, when you are talking to them online, it is harder to tell. You cannot see their facial expressions or body language, which makes it easier to lie.
This is just a small sample of the problems that online dating is causing. I believe that this trend will continue to grow until something is done to stop it.

Python is a high-level, general-purpose programming language. It is often compared to languages like C++, Perl, and Scheme. Python has an elegant syntax that is natural to read and easy to write. Python was created by Guido van Rossum in 1991. It is named after the BBC TV show Monty Python's Flying Circus.
Python is open source software and its design philosophy emphasizes code readability, notably using significant whitespace. Its syntax allows programmers to express concepts in fewer lines of code than would be possible in languages such as C++ or Java. Python supports multiple programming paradigms, including object-oriented, imperative and functional programming or procedural styles.
